en: In order for the app to personalize the feedback provided to you, we recommend that you input your personal information. Tap 'Settings' to proceed.

en: If you do not feel like doing so, no problem, the app will use predefined values instead. Tap 'Dashboard' to proceed.

no: Ingen spesielle forholdsregler er nødvendig med mindre du jobber/trener i spesielle omgivelser (innendørs) eller med begrenset evne til å opprettholde varmen

es: En este nivel, se recomienda prestar especial atención al comportamiento apropiado, hacer coincidir la ropa con el nivel de frío y proteger la piel expuesta. Ten cuidado de no usar demasiada ropa, porque la sudoración te enfriará.

et: At this level you are recommended to pay extra attention to appropriate behavior and match clothing to the cold level and protect exposed skin. Be aware not to overdress, because sweating will cool you down.

it: Il livello arancione significa che ci si aspetta un elevato stress termico da caldo.
de: The orange level means that high heat stress is expected.
es: El nivel naranja significa que se espera un alto estrés por calor.
fr: The orange level means that high heat stress is expected.
et: The orange level means that high heat stress is expected.
ja: The orange level means that high heat stress is expected.

en: This level is associated with severe heat stress.
da: Dette niveau er forbundet med betragteligt varmestress
nl: Rood: er worden ernstige problemen met hitte verwacht
sv: Denna nivån är associerad med allvarlig värmestress.
no: Dette nivået er assosiert med alvorlig varmestress.
el: This level is associated with severe heat stress.
it: Questo livello è associato con un grave stress termico da caldo.
de: This level is associated with severe heat stress.
es: Este nivel está asociado con un alto estrés por calor.
fr: This level is associated with severe heat stress.
et: This level is associated with severe heat stress.
ja: This level is associated with severe heat stress.

en: The score will increase towards higher warning levels if the weather agravates, your activity level increases or your clothing level increases.
da: Scoren stiger mod højere advarselsniveauer, hvis vejret forværres, dit aktivitetsniveau falder eller du tager noget af dit tøj af
nl: De score zal hoger worden als het weer warmer wordt, je meer kleding draagt of een zwaardere activiteit uitvoert
sv: Summan kommer att öka mot högre varningsnivåer ifall vädret förvärras, din aktivitetsnivå ökar eller din klädesnivå ökar.
no: Poengsummen vil øke mot høyere advarselsnivå hvis været forverres, aktivitetsnivået ditt økes eller mengden av klær økes.
el: The score will increase towards higher warning levels if the weather agravates, your activity level increases or your clothing level increases.
it:
Il punteggio aumenterà verso livelli
di avviso più elevati se il tempo peggiorerà, oppure se aumenterà la tua attività o il tuo vestiario
de: The score will increase towards higher warning levels if the weather agravates, your activity level increases or your clothing level increases.
es: El puntaje aumentará hacia niveles de advertencia más altos si el clima se agrava, aumenta tu nivel de actividad o aumenta tu nivel de ropa.
fr: The score will increase towards higher warning levels if the weather agravates, your activity level increases or your clothing level increases.
et: The score will increase towards higher warning levels if the weather agravates, your activity level increases or your clothing level increases.
ja: The score will increase towards higher warning levels if the weather agravates, your activity level increases or your clothing level increases.

en: You should be able to maintain normal activities. You may experience higher thermal strain and more sweating than normal.
da: You should be able to maintain normal activities. You may experience higher thermal strain and more sweating than normal.
nl: Je kan het als warmer dan normaal ervaren en zweten. In principe zou je wel je werkzaamheden moeten kunnen uitvoeren
sv: Du bör kunna upprätthålla normala aktiviteter men du kan uppleva högre värmestress och svettas mer än vanligt.
no: Du burde kunne opprettholde normale aktiviteter. Du vil kunne oppleve varmestress og svette mere enn vanlig.
el: You should be able to maintain normal activities. You may experience higher thermal strain and more sweating than normal.
it:
Dovresti essere in grado di continuare le tue 
normali attività. Potresti sperimentare livelli di tensione termica e di sudorazione più elevati del normale.
de: You should be able to maintain normal activities. You may experience higher thermal strain and more sweating than normal.
es: Deberías poder mantener actividades normales. Puede que experimentes una mayor tensión térmica y más sudoración de lo normal.
fr: You should be able to maintain normal activities. You may experience higher thermal strain and more sweating than normal.
et: You should be able to maintain normal activities. You may experience higher thermal strain and more sweating than normal.
ja: You should be able to maintain normal activities. You may experience higher thermal strain and more sweating than normal.

en: Consider clothing adjustments, more breaks and drink more than normal; especially when the score approaches the red heat stress level.
da: Overvej flere pauser, mindre påklædning og hyppigere væskeindtag; især når scoren øges
nl: Bespreek en denk na over kledingaanpassingen, meer pauzes en drink meer dan normaal. Met name als de score richting rood gaat.
sv: Överväg att klä dig lättare, ta fler raster och drick mer än vanligt; speciellt när summan närmar sig den röda värmestressnivån.
no: Vurder å justere klesmengden din, ta flere pauser og drikk mere enn vanlig. Spesielt når poensummen nermer seg det røde nivået.
el: Consider clothing adjustments, more breaks and and drink more than normal; especially when the score approaches the red heat stress level.
it: Considera di adattare il tuo vestiario, di effettuare più paude e di bere più del normale; specialmente quando il punteggio si avvicina al livello rosso di stress termico da caldo.
de: Consider clothing adjustments, more breaks and and drink more than normal; especially when the score approaches the red heat stress level.
es: Considera ajustes de ropa, más descansos y bebe más líquidos de lo normal; especialmente cuando el puntaje se acerca al nivel rojo de estrés por calor.
fr: Consider clothing adjustments, more breaks and and drink more than normal; especially when the score approaches the red heat stress level.
et: Consider clothing adjustments, more breaks and drink more than normal; especially when the score approaches the red heat stress level.
ja: Consider clothing adjustments, more breaks and drink more than normal; especially when the score approaches the red heat stress level.

en: Pay special attention to drinking sufficient during the first days with this heat stress.
da: Vær opmærksom på din væskebalance - især i de første dage med varmestress
nl: Zorg er voor dat je voldoende drinkt.
sv: Var extra uppmärksam på att dricka tillräckligt med vätska under de första dagarna med denna värmestressen.
no: Vær oppmerksom på å drikke tilstrekkelig, spesielt i løpet av de første dagene med dette varmestressnivået.
el: Pay special attention to drinking sufficient during the first days with this heat stress.
it: Presta particolare attenzione a bere sufficientemente durante i primi giorni con questo stress termico da caldo.
de: Pay special attention to drinking sufficient during the first days with this heat stress.
es: Presta especial atención a beber suficientes líquidos durante los primeros días con este estrés por calor.
fr: Pay special attention to drinking sufficient during the first days with this heat stress.
et: Pay special attention to drinking sufficient during the first days with this heat stress.
ja: Pay special attention to drinking sufficient during the first days with this heat stress.

en: Consider adjusting activities (heavy physical tasks during periods of the day with lowest heat) and allow time to adapt.
da: Overvej at justere/planlægge aktiviteter så fysisk krævende arbejde/træning ol. placeres på de tidspunkter af dagen hvor varmen er lavest
nl: Probeer zware activiteiten op koelere momenten van de dag te plannen en neem de tijd om je aan te passen.
sv: Överväg att anpassa dina aktiviteter (tungt fysiskt arbete under perioder av dagen med låg värme) och ge dig tid att anpassa dig till värmen.
no: Vuder å tilpasse aktivitetene dine så fysisk harde oppgaver ligger i løpet av dagens kaldeste perioder. Gi kroppen tid til å tilpasse seg.
el: Consider adjusting activities (heavy physical tasks during periods of the day with lowest heat) and allow time to adapt.
it: Considera di adattare il tuo livello di attività (mansioni pesanti a livello fisico durante i momenti meno caldi della giornata) e prenditi tempo per adattarti.
de: Consider adjusting activities (heavy physical tasks during periods of the day with lowest heat) and allow time to adapt.
es: Considera ajustar las actividades realizas (tareas físicas pesadas durante los períodos del día con el calor más bajo) y permitete algo de tiempo para adaptarte.
fr: Consider adjusting activities (heavy physical tasks during periods of the day with lowest heat) and allow time to adapt.
et: Consider adjusting activities (heavy physical tasks during periods of the day with lowest heat) and allow time to adapt.
ja: Consider adjusting activities (heavy physical tasks during periods of the day with lowest heat) and allow time to adapt.

en: Be aware that thirst is usually not a sufficient indicator when sweat losses are high.
da: Hvis du sveder meget skal du være opmærksom på at tørstfornemmelse ikke nødvendigvis er tilstrækkelig ift. forblive i væskebalance
nl: Drink op tijd, het dorstgevoel komt meestal te laat.
sv: Törst är sällan ett tillräckligt tecken när man svettas mycket.
no: Vær oppmerksom på, at tørst ofte ikke er en tilstrekkelig indikasjon på, når du skal drikke, når du svetter mye.
el: Be aware that thirst is usually not a sufficient indicator when sweat losses are high.
it: Tieni conto del fatto che la sete normalmente non è un indicatore sufficiente quando le perdite di sudore sono elevate.
de: Be aware that thirst is usually not a sufficient indicator when sweat losses are high.
es: Ten en cuenta que la sed generalmente no es un indicador suficientemente bueno cuando las pérdidas de sudor son altas.
fr: Be aware that thirst is usually not a sufficient indicator when sweat losses are high.
et: Be aware that thirst is usually not a sufficient indicator when sweat losses are high.
ja: Be aware that thirst is usually not a sufficient indicator when sweat losses are high.

en: Resting may lower heat stress.
da: Hvile eller flere pauser kan reducere dit varmestress.
nl: Rust kan de warmtelast verlagen
sv: Vila kan sänka värmestress.
no: Å holde pauser kan senke varmestressnivået.
el: Resting may lower heat stress.
it: Riposare può diminuire lo stress termico da caldo.
de: Resting may lower heat stress.
es: Descansar puede reducir el estrés por calor.
fr: Resting may lower heat stress.
et: Resting may lower heat stress.
ja: Resting may lower heat stress.

en: Be aware to compensate your sweat loss.
da: Vær obs på at drikke svarende til dit svedtab
nl: Denk er aan om je vochtverlies te compenseren
sv: Tänk på att kompensera för din vätskeförlust (svett).
no: Vær oppmerksom på å kompensere for vanntap (svette).
el: Be aware to compensate your sweat loss.
it: Presta attenzione a compensare la tua perdita di sudore.
de: Be aware to compensate your sweat loss.
es: Debes estar atento a la compensación de tu pérdida de sudor.
fr: Be aware to compensate your sweat loss.
et: Be aware to compensate your sweat loss.
ja: Be aware to compensate your sweat loss.

en: The heat will impact your physical performance.
da: Varme kan (og vil sandsynligvis) påvirke din præstationsevne
nl: De hitte zal je prestatievermogen verminderen.
sv: Värmen kommer att påverka din fysiska prestanda.
no: Varmen vill påvirke den fysiske ytelsen din.
el: The heat will impact your physical performance.
it: Il calore influenzerà il tuo rendimento fisico.
de: The heat will impact your physical performance.
es: El calor afectará tu rendimiento físico.
fr: The heat will impact your physical performance.
et: The heat will impact your physical performance.
ja: The heat will impact your physical performance.

en: Adjusting activities and allowing sufficient breaks will benefit your overall daily ability to cope with the heat.
da: Justering af dine aktiviteter (eller tilstrækkelige pauser) kan gavne din evne til at fuldføre dagens opgaver uden overdrevne negative effekter
nl: Pas je activiteiten aan en zorg voor voldoende rust om beter met de hitte om te kunnen gaan.
sv: Adjusting activities and allowing sufficient breaks will benefit your overall daily ability to cope with the heat.
no: Ved å tilpasse aktiviteter og tillate nok pauser kan du forbedre evnen til å takle varmestress.
el: Adjusting activities and allowing sufficient breaks will benefit your overall daily ability to cope with the heat.
it: L'adattamento del livello di attività e la realizzazione di pause sufficienti porterà benefici alla tua abilità generale di reagire al calore.
de: Adjusting activities and allowing sufficient breaks will benefit your overall daily ability to cope with the heat.
es: Ajustar las actividades que realizas y permitirte suficientes descansos beneficiará en general tu capacidad diaria para hacer frente al calor.
fr: Adjusting activities and allowing sufficient breaks will benefit your overall daily ability to cope with the heat.
et: Adjusting activities and allowing sufficient breaks will benefit your overall daily ability to cope with the heat.
ja: Adjusting activities and allowing sufficient breaks will benefit your overall daily ability to cope with the heat.

en: Increased airflow may be beneficial, even if skin is dry.
da: øget ventilation kan gavne din varmeafgivelse
nl: Een ventilator kan in deze omstandigheden verkoelend werken, zelfs als de huid droog is
sv: Ökad ventillering kan vara positivt även om huden är torr.
no: Øket ventilasjon kan ha en positiv effekt, også selvom huden føles tørr.
el: Increased airflow may be beneficial, even if skin is dry.
it: Un aumento del flusso d'aria può portare benefici, anche se la pelle è secca.
de: Increased airflow may be beneficial, even if skin is dry.
es: El aumento del flujo de aire puede ser beneficioso, incluso si la piel está seca.
fr: Increased airflow may be beneficial, even if skin is dry.
et: Increased airflow may be beneficial, even if skin is dry.
ja: Increased airflow may be beneficial, even if skin is dry.

en: Increased airflow may be beneficial if skin is wet. Externally applied water to the skin (e.g. spray; instead of only relying on sweating) will reduce the risk of dehydration, and potentially enhance the fan benefit.
da: Øget vind/ventilation kan gavne dig - især hvis du er svedig på huden. Alternativ (hvis din hud er tør) spray vand på huden og kombiner med ventilator
nl: Een ventilator kan in deze omstandigheden verkoelend werken als de huid nat is. Je kan de huid nathouden met een spray zodat je minder uitdroogt door zweet.
sv: Ökad ventillering kan vara positivt ifall huden är fuktig. Genom att fukta huden (t.ex. med spray) kan det sänka risken för uttorkning samt öka effekten av fläktning.
no: Øket ventilasjon kan han en positiv effekt hvis huden er våt. Fukt av huden (f.eks. ved å sprøyte med vann), kan minske risikoen for dehydrering og potensielt øke nytten fra en vifte.
el: Increased airflow may be beneficial if skin is wet. Externally applied water to the skin (e.g. spray; instead of only relying on sweating) will reduce the risk of dehydration, and potentially enhance the fan benefit.
it: Un aumento del flusso d’aria può portare benefici se la pelle è bagnata. L’acqua applicata esternamente alla pelle (per esempio spray; invece che fare affidamento sulla sola sudorazione) ridurrà il rischio di disidratazione, e potenzialmente aumenterà i benefici dell’uso dei ventilatori.
de: Increased airflow may be beneficial if skin is wet. Externally applied water to the skin (e.g. spray; instead of only relying on sweating) will reduce the risk of dehydration, and potentially enhance the fan benefit.
es: El aumento del flujo de aire puede ser beneficioso si la piel está húmeda. El agua aplicada externamente a la piel (por ejemplo, aerosol; en lugar de depender únicamente de la sudoración) reducirá el riesgo de deshidratación y potencialmente mejorará el beneficio de usar un ventilador.
fr: Increased airflow may be beneficial if skin is wet. Externally applied water to the skin (e.g. spray; instead of only relying on sweating) will reduce the risk of dehydration, and potentially enhance the fan benefit.
et: Increased airflow may be beneficial if skin is wet. Externally applied water to the skin (e.g. spray; instead of only relying on sweating) will reduce the risk of dehydration, and potentially enhance the fan benefit.
ja: Increased airflow may be beneficial if skin is wet. Externally applied water to the skin (e.g. spray; instead of only relying on sweating) will reduce the risk of dehydration, and potentially enhance the fan benefit.

en: Externally applied water to the skin (for instance: spray; instead of only relying on sweating) will reduce the risk of dehydration
da: Spray vand eller fugt huden i kombination med ventilator kan reducere varmestress og gavne din samlede væskebalance
nl: Het nathouden van de huid, zoals met een spray, zorgt voor verkoeling en minder uitdroging door zweet.
sv: Genom att fukta huden (t.ex. med spray, istället för att endast svettas) kan risken för uttorkning minska.
no: Vann påført huden (f.eks. ved sprøyting) vil minske risikoen for dehydrering.
el: Externally applied water to the skin (for instance: spray; instead of only relying on sweating) will reduce the risk of dehydration
it: L’acqua applicata esternamente alla pelle (per esempio spray; invece che fare affidamento sulla sola sudorazione) ridurrà il rischio di disidratazione
de: Externally applied water to the skin (for instance: spray; instead of only relying on sweating) will reduce the risk of dehydration
es: El agua aplicada externamente a la piel (por ejemplo: aerosol; en lugar de depender solo de la sudoración) reducirá el riesgo de deshidratación
fr: Externally applied water to the skin (for instance: spray; instead of only relying on sweating) will reduce the risk of dehydration
et: Externally applied water to the skin (for instance: spray; instead of only relying on sweating) will reduce the risk of dehydration
ja: Externally applied water to the skin (for instance: spray; instead of only relying on sweating) will reduce the risk of dehydration

da: ventilator ikke anbefalet når lufttemperaturen er over 43°C.
nl: Een ventilator, tocht of wind zorgt voor meer opwarming.
sv: Att öka ventilleringen är inte rekommenderat när lufttemperaturen överstiger 43°C.
no: Øket ventilasjon er ikke å anbefale, når temperaturen er mere enn 43°C.
el: Increased airflow is not recommendend when air temperature exceeds 43°C.
it: L'aumento del flusso d'aria non è raccomandato quando la temperatura dell'aria eccede i 43°C.
de: Increased airflow is not recommendend when air temperature exceeds 43°C.
es: No se recomienda aumentar el flujo de aire cuando la temperatura del aire supera los 43°C..
